about_the_game:
You wake up gasping for air, but your lungs burn as you cough up PFC fluid. Disoriented and alone, you find yourself trapped aboard a derelict space station. But you're not truly alone—anomalous activity has consumed the station! Your only chance for survival lies in getting to HANGAR 8 and escaping this looping nightmare before it’s too late!

What is HANGAR 8 about, what do you do?

HANGAR 8 is a sci-fi walking simulator crossed with a spooky spot-the-difference game inspired by The Exit 8. Be on the look out for anomalies between levels 1 to 8, while using level 0 as a reference. Anomalies could be anything from something being not quite right in the environment, to deadly monsters and otherworldly entities. HANGAR 8 is all about creating a tense psychological horror atmosphere and getting you to question your sanity while collecting key items and reading lost crew logbooks in order to escape the looping nightmare!

What can I expect from HANGAR 8?

  • A complete science-fiction psychological horror experience! HANGAR 8 is a complete game and if there may be any possible future updates, they will be FREE!

  • 30 to 120+ minutes for a single play-through, depending on your perceptive skills and how lucky you get with the random anomaly selection algorithm. (Auto-save feature for if you want to take a break and continue later!)

  • 50 Anomalies To Discover, offering replay-ability for multiple escape attempts! If you spot an anomaly, it will never repeat until all fifty anomalies are found. (There is a extra mode to enable all anomalies for a greater challenge!)

  • Collect the 6 key items required to escape, while finding 6 optional logbooks hidden throughout the space station to read for game lore!

  • 8 Achievements to gain, one of which will test your speed running skills! HANGAR 8 has a built-in timer and an official leaderboard on for those who want to challenge me (the dev) and optimise their escape times!

First Game By Solo Developer :3

legal_notice:
Please note that all lore within HANGAR 8 was written by a human at Twin Tail Digital, in English, and then that human (foolishly) made use of Machine Translation (by OpenAI) to translate from English to various other languages.
AI was not used in any other way.

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Linux distribution released after 2016
  • Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo E8200, AMD Athlon XE BE-2300, Raspberry Pi 4
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: 2 GB VRAM with Vulkan 1.0 support
  • Storage: 420 MB available space

name: HANGAR 8

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core 2 Duo E8200, AMD Athlon XE BE-2300
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: 2 GB VRAM with Vulkan 1.0 support
  • Storage: 420 MB available space
  • Sound Card: Would probably be a good idea to have a sound card, yeah. Built-in will do.

reviews:
“There are some terrifying anomalies to discover. Some of them can sneak up on you while others are in front of you but you know something terrible will happen. Both types of anomalies are fun to find and frightening to resolve.”
Ties That Bind Gaming
short_description: HANGAR 8 is a psychological horror set within the unsettling confines of a derelict space station. Brave the looping corridors to get to level 8, discover all anomalies, collect key items, and escape the nightmare!
supported_languages: English, French, Italian, German, Spanish - Spain, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese - Portugal, Russian, Simplified Chinese, Ukrainian, Hindi
